member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IManagerService
member.summary: Interface used by manager objects that provide services to other managers and game code via IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IManagerService.ManagerType
member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IManagerService.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.summary: Resizes the tree used to store contained objects.

member.summary: Called when the game clears the engine of objects (generally when clearing the current level / scene and before loading the next one).

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioManager.Unload
member.summary: Called when the game's graphics and disposable resources are no longer used or are invalid (due to exiting the game or the graphics device resetting). All resources should be disposed before exiting this method.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioManager.ManagerType
member.summary:
Determines which type this manager is registered under in the SceneInterface that contains it.
Please note: changing the return value to the ManagerType of another class will allow this manager to replace it in the SceneInterface (and provide replacement features and implementation).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the SceneInterface. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).
For managers that do not require a specific order a value of 100 is recommended.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioManager.GraphicsDeviceManager
member.summary: The GraphicsDeviceManager used by this manager.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioManager.MaximumAudioSources
member.summary: Maximum number of audio sources that can be played simultaneously. The number is limited on Xbox to 300, and on WP7 to 64.

member.summary: Determines if a sound is currently playing.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioState.Stopped
member.summary: The sound is not playing.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioState.Playing
member.summary: The sound is playing.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioType
member.summary: Determines how the sound changes in relationship to the viewer. Ambient sounds are heard equally from everywhere in the scene, whereas 3D sounds are relative to the viewer / listener.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioType.Ambient
member.summary: The sound is heard equally from everywhere in the scene.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioType.Point
member.summary: The sound is 3D and relative to the viewer / listener.

member.summary: Indicates the current move. This value increments each time the object is moved (when the World transform changes).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IMovableObject.UpdateType
member.summary:
Determines if objects receive update events from the engine and are tracked by the scenegraph.
Automatic update events are necessary to be affected by gravity, for components, and for the scenegraph to track moving objects. Objects without Automatic update events can still move, however the containing scenegraph (ObjectManager or LightManager) must be notified using Manager.Move(object).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IMovableObject.World
member.summary: World space transform of the object.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponentObject`1
member.summary: Interface used by objects that contain components.
member.typeparam:
Type of the parent class or interface that contains the components. This strongly types the components ensuring only components of the correct type can be assigned.
For instance all classes and objects that derive from SceneEntity use the ISceneEntity type allowing them to share components.
However lights use the ILight type to ensure entity components cannot accidently be assigned to them, and vice versa.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponentObject`1.Components
member.summary: Container that stores, manages, and updates the object's components.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Editor.IEditorRenderableObject.RenderEditorIcon(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ISceneState,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.BoundingBoxRenderHelper,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Implements rendering of in-editor icons and helpers.
This method is called twice per-frame: once with scene depth clipping enable, and once with it disabled.
member.param: Current state used to render the scene.
Helper used to draw lines associated with the object. Only calling Submit() is supported in this method, using other methods may affect rendering of lines drawn by other objects.
Indicates if the object is currently highlighted by the editor.
Indicates if the object is currently selected by the editor.
Indicates if the current rendering pass depth clips with the scene. If so rendered icons and helpers are occluded by scene objects.

Provides an asset wrapper for XNA SoundEffects containing the source repository name, file name, and direct access to the loaded asset. When visible in the SunBurn editor properties of this type automatically support drag and drop of repository sounds into the property.
The content repository provided must be loaded before creating an instance of this class otherwise the asset will fail to load.

member.summary: Implements a custom rendering pass. The pass occurs after scene rendering completes, but before post processing.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioSource.RenderEditorIcon(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ISceneState,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.BoundingBoxRenderHelper,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Implements rendering of in-editor icons and helpers.
This method is called twice per-frame: once with scene depth clipping enable, and once with it disabled.
member.param: Current state used to render the scene.
Helper used to draw lines associated with the object. Only calling Submit() is supported in this method, using other methods may affect rendering of lines drawn by other objects.
Indicates if the object is currently highlighted by the editor.
Indicates if the object is currently selected by the editor.
Indicates if the current rendering pass depth clips with the scene. If so rendered icons and helpers are occluded by scene objects.

member.summary: Indicates the current move. This value increments each time the object is moved (when the World transform changes).

member.summary: Unique id used to identify the object across multiple scene loads / reloads.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioSource.HullType
member.summary: Determines the bounds used for emitter culling (always returns HullType.Box).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioSource.UpdateType
member.summary:
Determines if objects receive update events from the engine and are tracked by the scenegraph.
Automatic update events are necessary to be affected by gravity, for components, and for the scenegraph to track moving objects. Objects without Automatic update events can still move, however the containing scenegraph (ObjectManager or LightManager) must be notified using Manager.Move(object).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioSource.Name
member.summary:
The object's current name.
Important note: Name can be changed at any time, HOWEVER managers will only see the change after removing and resubmitting the object.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Audio.AudioSource.Components
member.summary: Container that stores, manages, and updates the object's components.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.ICollisionManager
member.summary: Interface that provides access to the scene's collision manager. The collision manager provides automatic collision and physics for scene objects.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager
member.summary: Provides a built-in collision and lightweight physics implementation.

member.param: Service provider used to access all other manager services in this scene.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.Unload
member.summary: Disposes any graphics resource used internally by this object, and removes scene resources managed by this object. Commonly used during Game.UnloadContent.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.Update(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary:
Updates all object movement, applies forces, and calculates collisions.
For any calculations to apply BeginFrameRendering() must be called. This prevents games from slowing down due to receiving several Update() calls per rendered frame.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.BeginFrameRendering(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ISceneState)
member.summary: Sets up the object prior to rendering.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.EndFrameRendering
member.summary: Finalizes rendering.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.MoveObject(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.ICollisionObject,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.IObjectManager,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionPoint)
member.summary: Simulates the object move, checking for collisions along the way.
member.param: Object to move (collider).
Filled with collidee information during the call.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.Collide(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.ICollisionObject,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.ICollisionObject,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionPoint)
member.summary: Tests for collision between two objects. Assumes CollisionMove.Begin() is already called on the moving object.
member.param: Moving / collider object.
Potential collidee.
Filled with collidee information during the call.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.Clear
member.summary: Removes resources managed by this object. Commonly used while clearing the scene.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.ApplyPreferences(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ILightingSystemPreferences)
member.summary: Use to apply user quality and performance preferences to the resources managed by this object.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.ManagerType
member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.summary: Determines if the object is currently contacting another object or surface.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Amount of force applied to the object this frame from impulse sources such as impacts, exlposions, and similar.
The amount of force applied to the object is NOT affected by the collision time period (see GetForce() for details).

member.summary: World bounding area the object will move to this frame.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionReactDelegate
member.summary: Delegate used when two object collide.
member.param: The moving object.
The object hit by the moving object.
Contains information about the closest collision point to the collider.

Determines if the collision was handled by a prior event hander. If this value is true do NOT process any collision reaction code. If the event handler processes collision reaction code set this value to true to avoid another handler or SunBurn's built-in reaction code from processing.

The trigger hit by the moving object.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1
member.summary: Interface used by components that plug into other objects (also called object-level components).
member.typeparam:
Type of the parent class or interface that contains the components. This strongly types the components ensuring only components of the correct type can be assigned.
For instance all classes and objects that derive from SceneEntity use the ISceneEntity type allowing them to share components.
However lights use the ILight type to ensure entity components cannot accidently be assigned to them, and vice versa.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.OnInitialize
member.summary: Event called when the component's parent object is assigned or reassigned.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.OnComponentsListChanged
member.summary: Event called when components are added or removed from the parent object.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.OnMessage(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent{`0},SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponentMessage)
member.summary: Event called when another component issues a message to the parent object's components.
member.param: Sending component.
Message object.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.OnUpdate(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary: Event called when the parent object is updated during the game update loop.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.OnCollisionReact(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IMovableObject,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IMovableObject,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Collision.CollisionPoint,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Event called when the parent object collides with another object.
member.param: The moving object.
The object hit by the moving object.
Contains information about the closest collision point to the collider.

Determines if the collision was handled by a prior component. If this value is true do NOT process any collision reaction code. If the component processes collision reaction code set this value to true to avoid another component or SunBurn's built-in reaction code from processing.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.OnCollisionTrigger(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IMovableObject,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IMovableObject)
member.summary:
Event called when the parent object collides with another object, but only when the parent's CollisionType is set to Trigger.
The component can then apply custom trigger code like damage, apply force, and more.
member.param: The moving object.
The trigger hit by the moving object.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.ComponentType
member.summary:
Type used to retrieve the component from the parent object. The component class must derive from or implement this type. This is generally the class type (eg: "this.GetType();");
Only one component of a specific type can be used by the parent object at a time. This allows components to replace one another and be used interchangeably by using the same type.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IComponent`1.ParentObject
member.summary: Parent object which the component controls or interacts with.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.BaseComponent`1
member.summary:
Base class used by all components. Warning: this class does not support serialization and should not be used to create custom components, instead derive from either the BaseComponentAutoSerialization or BaseComponentManualSerialization classes.
Provides built-in support for sending inter-component messages, calling OnInitialize() when the parent object changes, and automatic ComponentType using the derived class type.
member.typeparam:
Type of the parent class or interface that contains the components. This strongly types the components ensuring only components of the correct type can be assigned.
For instance all classes and objects that derive from SceneEntity use the ISceneEntity type allowing them to share components.
However lights use the ILight type to ensure entity components cannot accidently be assigned to them, and vice versa.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.BaseComponentAutoSerialization`1
member.summary:
Base class used to create components with auto serialization support.
To serialize a field add the [SerializeMember] attribute to it. Please note: for the data to be visible in-editor it must be provided via a property. This requires all serialized editor visible members to implement a property with a backing field where the property is editor visible and the backing field serialized by adding the [SerializeMember] attribute.
Provides built-in support for sending inter-component messages, calling OnInitialize() when the parent object changes, and automatic ComponentType using the derived class type.
member.typeparam:
Type of the parent class or interface that contains the components. This strongly types the components ensuring only components of the correct type can be assigned.
For instance all classes and objects that derive from SceneEntity use the ISceneEntity type allowing them to share components.
However lights use the ILight type to ensure entity components cannot accidently be assigned to them, and vice versa.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.BaseComponentManualSerialization`1
member.summary:
Base class used to create components with manual serialization support.
To serialize a member override the GetObjectData() and SetObjectData() methods and use the SerializationHelper class to read / write the member to the provided SerializationInfo object.
Provides built-in support for sending inter-component messages, calling OnInitialize() when the parent object changes, and automatic ComponentType using the derived class type.
member.typeparam:
Type of the parent class or interface that contains the components. This strongly types the components ensuring only components of the correct type can be assigned.
For instance all classes and objects that derive from SceneEntity use the ISceneEntity type allowing them to share components.
However lights use the ILight type to ensure entity components cannot accidently be assigned to them, and vice versa.

member.summary: Deserializes object data from the provided SerializationInfo.
member.param: Contains the serialized object data.

member.summary: Serializes object data to the provided SerializationInfo.
member.param: SerializationInfo to store the serialized data.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ContentRepository
member.summary:
Provides storage of automatically loaded game content. This includes models, light maps, and light occlusion buffers loaded with scenes and during rendering.
Content repositories must be loaded via a content manager before scenes and other objects referencing their contents are loaded.

member.summary: Only for serialization. Using this constructor in game code may cause an exception.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ContentRepository.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the content repository. This removes it from the list of available repositories.

member.summary:
Loads an asset using the relative source path. The path includes the original file extension.
For instance: "models\\chair.fbx"
member.param: Asset relative source path.
Determines if an exception should be thrown when the asset does not exist.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ContentRepository.Load``1(System.String)
member.summary:
Loads an asset using the xna style path. The path does not include the file extension.
For instance: "models\\chair"
member.param: Asset path.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ContentRepository.Clear
member.summary: Removes all objects from the container. Commonly used while clearing the scene.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ContentRepository.DeleteLightingCache
member.summary:
Deletes all light maps from the repository. This is helpful when some contained light maps are no longer used.
Deleting the cache will prevent unused light maps from bloating game releases, however all scene lighting will need to be recalculated afterward.

member.summary: Creates a new CustomFrameBufferCollection instance.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.FrameBuffers
member.summary:
Provides automatic creation, storage, and management of shared buffers (render targets) used during rendering.
These buffers include g-buffers, lighting-buffers, and post processing buffers.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.FrameBuffers.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.IGraphicsDeviceService,System.Int32,System.Int32,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.DetailPreference,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.DetailPreference)
member.summary: Creates a new FrameBuffers instance.
member.param: Custom buffer width.
Custom buffer height.
Increases visual quality at the cost of performance. Generally used in visualizations, most games do not need this option.
Increases lighting quality at the cost of performance. Adds additional lighting range when using HDR.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.UpdateDelegate
member.summary: Delegate used when updating movable objects.
member.param: Object to update.
Time to up date the object to.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.UpdateType
member.summary:
Determines if objects receive update events from the engine and are tracked by the scenegraph.
Automatic update events are necessary to be affected by gravity, for components, and for the scenegraph to track moving objects. Objects without Automatic update events can still move, however the containing scenegraph (ObjectManager or LightManager) must be notified using Manager.Move(object).

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.UpdateType.None
member.summary: Object does not receive update events and is not tracked by the scenegraph. The object can still move, however the containing scenegraph (ObjectManager or LightManager) must be notified using Manager.Move(object).

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.UpdateType.Automatic
member.summary:
Object receives update events from the engine and is automatically tracked by the scenegraph allowing it to move simply by setting the World transform.
Automatic update events are necessary to be affected by gravity, for components, and for the scenegraph to track moving objects.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility
member.summary:
Defines how objects are rendered.
This enumeration is a Flag, which allows combining multiple values using the Logical OR operator (example: "ObjectVisibility.Rendered | ObjectVisibility.CastShadows", both renders objects and casts shadows from them).

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility.None
member.summary: Object is not rendered.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility.Rendered
member.summary: Object is rendered on screen.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility.CastShadows
member.summary: Object casts shadows.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility.RenderedInEditor
member.summary: Object is rendered on screen when the editor is open.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility.RenderedAndCastShadows
member.summary: Object is rendered on screen and casts shadows.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter
member.summary:
Defines the types of objects that should be returned in a Find() query.
This enumeration is a Flag, which allows combining multiple values using the Logical OR operator (example: "ObjectFilter.Dynamic | ObjectFilter.Enabled", finds objects that are both dynamic and enabled).

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.Dynamic
member.summary: Used to include objects of type ObjectType.Dynamic in the query results.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.Static
member.summary: Used to include objects of type ObjectType.Static in the query results.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.Enabled
member.summary:
Used to include objects that are enabled in the query results.
If the objects being queried do not support enabling / disabling they will be included in the query results regardless of whether this flag is used.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.Disabled
member.summary:
Used to include objects that are disabled in the query results.
If the objects being queried do not support enabling / disabling they will be included in the query results regardless of whether this flag is used.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.DynamicAndStatic
member.summary: Used to include objects of type ObjectType.Dynamic and ObjectType.Static in the query results.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.EnabledAndDisabled
member.summary: Used to include both objects that are enabled and disabled in the query results.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.EnabledDynamicAndStatic
member.summary: Used to include enabled objects of type ObjectType.Dynamic and ObjectType.Static in the query results.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectFilter.All
member.summary:
Used to include all objects in the query results.
Note: this includes disabled objects, which in most cases should not be used in normal rendering.

member.summary:
Provides information on the device capabilities supported by the current hardware and if those capabilities are allowed by the current configuration. This allows users to select various system specific configurations and for developers to test a wide variety of configurations on a single machine.
Check a capability property to see if it's supported and allowed. Setting a capability property to true will allow it only if the current hardware supports it.

Please note: all vertices and primitives contained in the render helper *must* be in the same space (ie: object space, world space, ...), as they are rendered all at once in the Render method using the same effect property values (including world, view, and projection transforms).

Please note: this method expects all effect property values including transforms to be set correctly. If using BasicEffect remember to enable VertexColorEnabled for vertex colors to be visible.

member.summary: Unused. Resources assigned to the manager are not removed until they are disposed (during the Unload method).

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ResourceManager.Unload
member.summary:
Disposes and removes all IDisposable resources. Unloads but continues tracking IUnloadable resources.
Commonly used during Game.UnloadContent.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ResourceManager.ShareMaterialsBetweenModels
member.summary:
Determines if material effects loaded from the content pipeline are shared based on the source material file.
As an example models and effects that load the material "Materials\Rock.mat" will all share a single reference to the same "Materials\Rock.mat" material effect. Modifying properties on the effect will change the material properties for all models and effects referencing it.
Disabling shared materials emulates the behavior of SunBurn prior to version 2.0.13 and standard XNA, where loading multiple models will create multiple unique copies of the same material effect.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ResourceManager.ManagerType
member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ResourceManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.SceneInterface
member.summary:
Acts as both a service provider and component manager for a scene.
As a service provider its contained manager services can be requested by type and accessed through common interfaces, making both using the built-in managers and writing custom replacement managers easy.
As a component manager all contained manager services automatically receive calls to BeginFrameRendering, EndFrameRendering, Update, and more, allowing custom managers to be plugged in and run with out writing any additional code to specifically handle them.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.SceneInterface.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.IGraphicsDeviceService)
member.summary: Creates a new SceneInterface instance.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.SceneInterface.CreateDefaultManagers(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates and adds a default set of manager services. This makes initializing the SceneInterface easier.
Depending on the creation options provided the following manager services will be created:
Always -ResourceManager -ObjectManager -LightManager -AvatarManager -PostProcessManager -CollisionManager -LightMapManager -LightingSystemEditor
Forward rendering -RenderManager -LightManager
Deferred rednering -DeferredRenderManager -DeferredShadowMapManager

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.SceneInterface.AddManager(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.IManagerService)
member.summary: Adds a manager service to the provider.

member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Editor.LightingSystemEditor.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.summary: Sets both the view, projection, and their inverse matrices. Used to improve performance in effects that automatically generate an inverse matrix when the view and project are set, by providing a cached or precalculated inverse matrix with the view and project matrices.
member.param: View matrix applied to geometry using this effect.
Inverse view matrix applied to geometry using this effect.
Projection matrix applied to geometry using this effect.
Inverse projection matrix applied to geometry using this effect.

member.summary: Sets both the world and inverse world matrices. Used to improve performance in effects that automatically generate an inverse world matrix when the world matrix is set, by providing a cached or precalculated inverse matrix with the world matrix.
member.param: World matrix applied to geometry using this effect.
Inverse world matrix applied to geometry using this effect.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.DiffuseMapLayer1Texture
member.summary:
Diffuse texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Red blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.DiffuseMapLayer2Texture
member.summary:
Diffuse texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Green blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.DiffuseMapLayer3Texture
member.summary:
Diffuse texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Blue blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.DiffuseMapLayer4Texture
member.summary:
Diffuse texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Alpha blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.NormalMapLayer1Texture
member.summary:
Normal map texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Red blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.NormalMapLayer2Texture
member.summary:
Normal map texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Green blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.NormalMapLayer3Texture
member.summary:
Normal map texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Blue blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.NormalMapLayer4Texture
member.summary:
Normal map texture used in blend mapping (associated with the Alpha blend map texture channel).
For optimal performance always use the lowest layers first (for instance: if using two layers use layer 1 and layer 2).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.HeightMapTexture
member.summary:
Texture containing height values used to displace a terrain mesh. Also used for low frequency lighting.
Requires a HalfSingle format texture.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.BlendMapTexture
member.summary: Texture containing intensity values used to blend diffuse and normal map textures into the final material. Each texture channel (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha) controls a terrain texture layer (layer 1, 2, 3, 4).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.NormalMapStrength
member.summary: Controls the depth or detail level of low frequency lighting on a terrain.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.DiffuseScale
member.summary: Adjusts the number of times the blend mapped materials tile across a terrain's mesh. Similar to uv scale when texture mapping.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.HeightScale
member.summary: Adjusts the terrain displacement magnitude.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.Tiling
member.summary: Adjusts the number of times the height map tiles across a terrain's mesh. Similar to uv scale when texture mapping.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.SpecularPower
member.summary: Power applied to material specular reflections. Affects how shiny a material appears.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.SpecularAmount
member.summary: Intensity applied to material specular reflections. Affects how intense the specular appears.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.SpecularColor
member.summary: Color applied to material specular reflections.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.BaseTerrainEffect.MeshSegments
member.summary: Density or tessellation of the terrain mesh.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.IShadowGenerateEffect
member.summary: Interface that provides custom effects with shadow map generation support.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.IShadowGenerateEffect.SetCameraView(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary:
Sets the camera view and inverse camera view matrices. These are the matrices used in the final on-screen render from the camera / player point of view.
These matrices will differ from the standard view and inverse view matrices when rendering from an alternate point of view (for instance during shadow map and cube map generation).
member.param: Camera view matrix applied to geometry using this effect.
Camera inverse view matrix applied to geometry using this effect.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.IShadowGenerateEffect.SupportsShadowGeneration
member.summary: Determines if the effect is capable of generating shadow maps. Objects using effects unable to generate shadow maps automatically use the built-in shadow effect, however this puts heavy restrictions on how the effects handle rendering (only basic vertex transforms are supported).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.IShadowGenerateEffect.ShadowPrimaryBias
member.summary: Main property used to eliminate shadow artifacts.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.IShadowGenerateEffect.ShadowSecondaryBias
member.summary: Additional fine-tuned property used to eliminate shadow artifacts.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.IShadowGenerateEffect.ShadowArea
member.summary: Bounding area of the shadow source, where the bounds center is the actual shadow source location, and the radius is either the source radius (for point sources) or the maximum view based casting distance (for directional sources).

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Effects.Forward.ShadowEffect.SetCameraView(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary:
Sets the camera view and inverse camera view matrices. These are the matrices used in the final on-screen render from the camera / player point of view.
These matrices will differ from the standard view and inverse view matrices when rendering from an alternate point of view (for instance during shadow map and cube map generation).
member.param: Camera view matrix applied to geometry using this effect.
Camera inverse view matrix applied to geometry using this effect.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.BaseLight.UpdateType
member.summary:
Determines if objects receive update events from the engine and are tracked by the scenegraph.
Automatic update events are necessary to be affected by gravity, for components, and for the scenegraph to track moving objects. Objects without Automatic update events can still move, however the containing scenegraph (ObjectManager or LightManager) must be notified using Manager.Move(object).

member.summary:

Important note: Name can be changed at any time, HOWEVER managers will only see the change after removing and resubmitting the object.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.ILightQuery
member.summary: Provides an interface for retrieving lights contained in a volume from a scenegraph.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.ILightQuery.GetCompositeLighting(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.BoundingBox,System.Single,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.LightingType)
member.summary:
Generates approximate lighting for an area in world space. The returned composite lighting is packed into a single directional and ambient light for fast single-pass lighting.
Note: because this information is approximated smaller world space areas will result in more accurate lighting. Also the approximation is calculated on the cpu and cannot take into account shadowing.
member.param: Bounding area used to determine approximate lighting.

Blending value (0.0f - 1.0f) that determines how much approximate lighting contributes to ambient lighting. Approximate lighting can create highly directional lighting, using a higher blending value can create softer, more realistic lighting.
Light types to include in approximate lighting.
member.returns: Composite lighting packed into a single directional and ambient light.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.ILightQuery.GetCompositeLighting(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.BoundingBox@,System.Single,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.LightingType,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.CompositeLighting@)

member.param: Bounding area used to determine approximate lighting.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.BaseLightMapManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.summary: Disposes any graphics resource used internally by this object, and removes scene resources managed by this object. Commonly used during Game.UnloadContent.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.LightManager.ManagerType
member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Lights.LightManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.IShadowMap.ContentsAreValid
member.summary:
Used to determine if the shadow map contents are valid or if the contents need to be re-rendered.
The default SunBurn shadow mapping implementation renders shadow map contents every frame, however custom implementations can provide static shadow maps.
Please note: if shadow maps are static and the contents are valid DO NOT call ShadowRenderTargetGroup Begin() and End(). On the Xbox this will invalidate the render target data.
However skipping calls to Begin and End require calling ShadowRenderTargetGroup.UpdateRenderTargetTexture() to ensure the shadow texture is up to date.
When using the built-in render managers this is all handled automatically.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.IShadowMap.Surfaces
member.summary: Array of surfaces used to render the shadow map. Each surface contains its own section within a render target. Surfaces are used for multi-part rendering and level-of-detail.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.IShadowMap.CustomRenderTarget
member.summary: Used to provide a custom render target for the shadow map. Though this allows custom render targets it also bypasses render target retrieval from the ShadowMapCache, which can cause higher memory usage.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.IShadowMap.ShadowEffect
member.summary: Effect used for shadow map rendering. The effect should support both generating the shadow map and rendering shadows to the scene.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.IAvatarManager.LightingIntensity
member.summary: Controls avatar lighting intensity, providing a means to tune avatar lighting to the rest of the scene. An intensity of 1.0f keeps avatar lighting the same, a value of 0.5f halves the lighting intensity, while 2.0f doubles it.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.IAvatar.Visibility
member.summary:
Defines how the avatar is rendered.
This enumeration is a Flag, which allows combining multiple values using the Logical OR operator (example: "ObjectVisibility.Rendered | ObjectVisibility.CastShadows", both renders the avatar and casts shadows from it).

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.RenderCustomPass(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ISceneState)

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.RenderEditorIcon(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ISceneState,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.BoundingBoxRenderHelper,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Implements rendering of in-editor icons and helpers.
This method is called twice per-frame: once with scene depth clipping enable, and once with it disabled.
member.param: Current state used to render the scene.
Helper used to draw lines associated with the object. Only calling Submit() is supported in this method, using other methods may affect rendering of lines drawn by other objects.
Indicates if the object is currently highlighted by the editor.
Indicates if the object is currently selected by the editor.
Indicates if the current rendering pass depth clips with the scene. If so rendered icons and helpers are occluded by scene objects.

member.name: E:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.UpdateEvent
member.summary: Event used to update the object at regular intervals. This and all events are only called on dynamic objects.

member.summary: Unique id used to identify the object across multiple scene loads / reloads.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.InfiniteBounds
member.summary: Indicates the object bounding area spans the entire world and the object is always visible.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.MoveId
member.summary: Indicates the current move. This value increments each time the object is moved (when the World transform changes).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.Name
member.summary:
The object's current name.
Important note: Name can be changed at any time, HOWEVER managers will only see the change after removing and resubmitting the object.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.UpdateType
member.summary:
Determines if objects receive update events from the engine and are tracked by the scenegraph.
Automatic update events are necessary to be affected by gravity, for components, and for the scenegraph to track moving objects. Objects without Automatic update events can still move, however the containing scenegraph (ObjectManager or LightManager) must be notified using Manager.Move(object).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.Avatar.Visibility
member.summary:
Defines how the avatar is rendered.
This enumeration is a Flag, which allows combining multiple values using the Logical OR operator (example: "ObjectVisibility.Rendered | ObjectVisibility.CastShadows", both renders the avatar and casts shadows from it).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.AvatarManager.ManagerType
member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.AvatarManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.AvatarManager.GraphicsDeviceManager
member.summary: The current GraphicsDeviceManager used by this object.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.AvatarManager.AmbientBlend
member.summary: Controls avatar lighting by blending between approximate directional and ambient lighting. A blending value of 0.0f makes avatar lighting highly directional, while a value of 1.0f makes avatar lighting highly ambient.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.AvatarManager.LightingIntensity
member.summary: Controls avatar lighting intensity, providing a means to tune avatar lighting to the rest of the scene. An intensity of 1.0f keeps avatar lighting the same, a value of 0.5f halves the lighting intensity, while 2.0f doubles it.

Effect applied to the mesh during rendering.
IndexBuffer that contains the mesh geometry.
VertexBuffer that contains the mesh geometry.
Index into the buffer that mesh geometry begins. For indexed meshes this is the first index in the index buffer. For non-indexed meshes this is the first vertex in the vertex buffer.
Primitive format the mesh geometry is stored in.
Number of primitives in the mesh geometry.
Offset added to each index in the index buffer during rendering.

member.summary: Recalculates the mesh batching information. This may become necessary if the mesh effect changes from a non-transparent mode to transparent.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.RenderableMesh.RemapEffect
member.summary: Should be called by custom renderers when receiving a ReplaceEffect event from the editor. Replaces the current effect with an editor assigned effect.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.RenderableMesh.SetWorldAndWorldToObject(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary:
Sets both the world and inverse world matrices. Used to improve performance when the world matrix is set, by providing a cached or precalculated inverse matrix with the world matrix.
Note: the matrix should only contain the objectToWorld (not the meshToWorld) transform. The mesh specific meshToObject transform is applied using the MeshToObject property.
member.param: World space transform of the object.
Inverse world space transform of the object.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.RenderableMesh.SetWorldAndWorldToObject(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix@)
member.summary:
Sets both the world and inverse world matrices. Used to improve performance when the world matrix is set, by providing a cached or precalculated inverse matrix with the world matrix.
Note: the matrix should only contain the objectToWorld (not the meshToWorld) transform. The mesh specific meshToObject transform is applied using the MeshToObject property.
member.param: World space transform of the object.
Inverse world space transform of the object.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.IObjectManager
member.summary: Interface that provides access to the scene's object manager. The object manager provides methods for storing and querying scene objects.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.IObjectManager.SubmitStaticSceneObject(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Model,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility)
member.summary:
Helper method that creates and submits a static scene object using a method layout similar to SunBurn 1.2.x.
NOTE: This method creates a single scene object for an entire model. This is ideal for small models such as props, however large models that represent entire rooms or scenes need to be split into separate objects per model mesh using SubmitStaticSceneObjectPerMesh.
member.param: Source model.
Scene object world transform.

Defines how the object is rendered. This enumeration is a Flag, which allows combining multiple values using the Logical OR operator (example: "ObjectVisibility.Rendered | ObjectVisibility.CastShadows", both renders objects and casts shadows from them).

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.IObjectManager.SubmitStaticSceneObjectPerMesh(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Model,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ObjectVisibility)
member.summary:
Helper method that creates and submits a static scene object using a method layout similar to SunBurn 1.2.x.
NOTE: This method creates a scene object for each mesh contained in the model. This is ideal for large models that represent entire rooms or scenes, however small models such as props should be contained in a single scene object using SubmitStaticSceneObject.
member.param: Source model.
Scene object world transform.

Defines how the object is rendered. This enumeration is a Flag, which allows combining multiple values using the Logical OR operator (example: "ObjectVisibility.Rendered | ObjectVisibility.CastShadows", both renders objects and casts shadows from them).

member.summary: Disposes any graphics resource used internally by this object, and removes scene resources managed by this object. Commonly used during Game.UnloadContent.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.ObjectManager.ManagerType
member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.ObjectManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.summary:
Recalculates the object bounding area based on all contained meshes.
Calling this method may become necessary if a mesh bounding area is altered after being added to the object.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SceneEntity.CalculateObjectBounds(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.BoundingBox@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.BoundingSphere@)

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SceneEntity.CalculateWorldBounds(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.BoundingBox@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.BoundingSphere@,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Updates the object world bounds based on the current world transform and object space bounds.
NOTE: when implementing custom bounds ensure the hull type (box or sphere) is completely enclosed by the other bounds type. For instance if the hull type is Box then the bounding sphere should completely contain the bounding box, and vice-versa. This is critical for correct collision.
member.param: World bounds to update.
World bounds to update.
Indicates the object move id is already updated.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SceneEntity.RenderCustomPass(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ISceneState)
member.summary: Implements a custom rendering pass. The pass occurs after scene rendering completes, but before post processing.
member.param: Current state used to render the scene.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SceneEntity.RenderEditorIcon(SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.ISceneState,SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Core.BoundingBoxRenderHelper,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Implements rendering of in-editor icons and helpers.
This method is called twice per-frame: once with scene depth clipping enable, and once with it disabled.
member.param: Current state used to render the scene.
Helper used to draw lines associated with the object. Only calling Submit() is supported in this method, using other methods may affect rendering of lines drawn by other objects.
Indicates if the object is currently highlighted by the editor.
Indicates if the object is currently selected by the editor.
Indicates if the current rendering pass depth clips with the scene. If so rendered icons and helpers are occluded by scene objects.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SceneEntity.UpdateType
member.summary:
Determines if objects receive update events from the engine and are tracked by the scenegraph.
Automatic update events are necessary to be affected by gravity, for components, and for the scenegraph to track moving objects. Objects without Automatic update events can still move, however the containing scenegraph (ObjectManager or LightManager) must be notified using Manager.Move(object).

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.ModelAsset
member.summary:
Provides an asset wrapper for XNA Models containing the source repository name, file name, and direct access to the loaded asset. When visible in the SunBurn editor properties of this type automatically support drag and drop of repository models into the property.
The content repository provided must be loaded before creating an instance of this class otherwise the asset will fail to load.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.ModelAsset.Empty
member.summary: Provides an empty ModelAsset which can be used to initialize properties of this type.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.ModelAsset.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ModelAsset instance and loads the provided model.
member.param: Name of the content repository, which contains the asset.
Relative path to the file the asset is loaded from.
Specific ModelMesh that should be used when constructing objects from this ModelAsset. Set to null or empty to use the entire model.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.ModelAsset.ModelMeshName
member.summary:
Specific ModelMesh that should be used when constructing objects from this ModelAsset.
If SourceAssetFilePath is valid and this value is empty then the object should use the entire Model.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.StaticLightingType

member.summary: Object does not receive illumination from BakedDown light sources.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.StaticLightingType.Composite
member.summary: Object receives illumination from an approximate combination of all BakedDown light sources.

member.name: F:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.StaticLightingType.BakedDown
member.summary: Object receives illumination from BakedDown light sources using light maps (textures) generated in-editor.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SpriteContainer
member.summary:
Specialized 2D scene object used to store and render sprites using SunBurn's forward and deferred rendering systems and effects.
Create an instance using SpriteManager.CreateSpriteContainer().

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SpriteContainer.Begin
member.summary: Prepares the container for new sprites, also clears all existing sprites from the container.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SpriteContainer.Add(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Effect,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a sprite to this container. Can only be used between calls to Begin() and End().
member.param: Effect applied to the sprite during rendering.
Size of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)
Position of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)

Controls both the z-sorting and the height between sprites, which is critical for proper shadowing. If shadows are too disconnected form the caster try reducing the depth between the shadow caster and receiver.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SpriteContainer.Add(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Effect,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a sprite to this container. Can only be used between calls to Begin() and End().
member.param: Effect applied to the sprite during rendering.
Size of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)
Position of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)
Rotation of the sprite in radians.

Controls both the z-sorting and the height between sprites, which is critical for proper shadowing. If shadows are too disconnected form the caster try reducing the depth between the shadow caster and receiver.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SpriteContainer.Add(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Effect,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a sprite to this container. Can only be used between calls to Begin() and End().
member.param: Effect applied to the sprite during rendering.
Size of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)
Position of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)
Rotation of the sprite in radians.
Indicates the sprite origin or pivot point (offset from the sprite center).

Controls both the z-sorting and the height between sprites, which is critical for proper shadowing. If shadows are too disconnected form the caster try reducing the depth between the shadow caster and receiver.

member.name: M:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SpriteContainer.Add(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Effect,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single)

Size of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)
Position of the sprite (in world-space if the container uses an identity world transform, otherwise in object-space)
Indicates the number of times a material will tile across the sprite.
Indicates the uv offset applied to a material on the sprite (in uv coordinates, where a single material tile ranges from 0.0f - 1.0f).

Controls both the z-sorting and the height between sprites, which is critical for proper shadowing. If shadows are too disconnected form the caster try reducing the depth between the shadow caster and receiver.

member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Rendering.SpriteManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Serialization.SerializationInclusionModelAttribute
member.summary:
Provides an inclusion based model for member serialization. Please note: if the class implements IFullSerializable in its hierarchy chain this attribute is ignored and the full serializable methods are used instead.
By default .Net uses an exclusion based serialization model, which serializes ALL members and requires specifically excluding those that should not be serialized.
In contrast this attribute enables an inclusion based model to serialize members of the class. This means by default NO members are serialized and members can be specifically included by adding the [SerializeMember] attribute to them.

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Serialization.SerializeMemberAttribute
member.summary: Used to include a member in serialization when the inclusion based model is active on the containing class (see [SerializationInclusionModel]).

member.name: T:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.IShadowMapVisibility
member.summary: Interface that provides support for determining shadow visibility and level-of-detail information.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.IShadowMapVisibility.ShadowLODRangeHints
member.summary:
Determines how far from the camera a directional shadow level-of-detail (lod) will stretch before transitioning to the next lod.
Index 0 controls the highest level of detail, 1 controls the next highest, and so on.
The range is normalized relative to the environment ShadowFadeEndDistance, for instance a value of 1.0 transitions at the ShadowFadeEndDistance whereas a value of 0.25 transitions at (ShadowFadeEndDistance * 0.25).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.IShadowMapVisibility.ShadowLODEnabled
member.summary:
Determines if a directional shadow level-of-detail (lod) is enabled and will have its shadow map filled with an image of the scene. Disabling unneeded lods reduces the number of rendered objects and draw calls.
Index 0 controls the highest level of detail, 1 controls the next highest, and so on.
Unlike point light shadows, directional light shadows render all of their lods every frame. Each lod represents a different area in front of the camera with the highest lod closest to the viewer. For some games (such as top-down perspective games) only a single lod is necessary and the rest can be disabled.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.BaseShadowMapManager.ManagerType
member.summary: Gets the manager specific Type used as a unique key for storing and requesting the manager from the IManagerServiceProvider.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.BaseShadowMapManager.ManagerProcessOrder
member.summary:
Sets the order this manager is processed relative to other managers in the IManagerServiceProvider. Managers with lower processing order values are processed first.
In the case of BeginFrameRendering and EndFrameRendering, BeginFrameRendering is processed in the normal order (lowest order value to highest), however EndFrameRendering is processed in reverse order (highest to lowest) to ensure the first manager begun is the last one ended (FILO).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.BaseShadowMapManager.ShadowLODRangeHints
member.summary:
Determines how far from the camera a directional shadow level-of-detail (lod) will stretch before transitioning to the next lod.
Index 0 controls the highest level of detail, 1 controls the next highest, and so on.
The range is normalized relative to the environment ShadowFadeEndDistance, for instance a value of 1.0 transitions at the ShadowFadeEndDistance whereas a value of 0.25 transitions at (ShadowFadeEndDistance * 0.25).

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.BaseShadowMapManager.ShadowLODEnabled
member.summary:
Determines if a directional shadow level-of-detail (lod) is enabled and will have its shadow map filled with an image of the scene. Disabling unneeded lods reduces the number of rendered objects and draw calls.
Index 0 controls the highest level of detail, 1 controls the next highest, and so on.
Unlike point light shadows, directional light shadows render all of their lods every frame. Each lod represents a different area in front of the camera with the highest lod closest to the viewer. For some games (such as top-down perspective games) only a single lod is necessary and the rest can be disabled.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.BaseShadowMapManager.PreferHalfFloatTextureFormat
member.summary: True when smaller half-float format render targets are preferred. These formats consume less memory and generally perform better, but have lower accuracy on directional lights.

member.name: P:SynapseGaming.LightingSystem.Shadows.ShadowRenderTargetGroup.ContentsAreValid
member.summary:
Used to determine if the render target contents are valid or if the contents need to be re-rendered.
The default SunBurn shadow mapping implementation renders shadow map contents every frame, however custom implementations can provide static shadow maps.
Please note: if shadow maps are static and the contents are valid DO NOT call ShadowRenderTargetGroup Begin() and End(). On the Xbox this will invalidate the render target data.
However skipping calls to Begin and End require calling ShadowRenderTargetGroup.UpdateRenderTargetTexture() to ensure the shadow texture is up to date.
When using the built-in render managers this is all handled automatically.
